data.title: Iconic park on Dodge Street
data.text: Memorial Park is a kind of iconic site--a large park, rose garden, space for sitting, jogging, sledding in the winter, etc.  It is in a nice older neighborhood of Omaha, just north of Dodge Street, Elmwood Park and the UNO campus.  The Memorial is on top of the hill.

data.title: Killer views
data.text: Fantastic place to run/jog through in Omaha. Beautiful in morning as Sun rises. Great paths for running and good hill to climb. Top place for me to run through when I visit Omaha.

data.title: Fly a Kite!
data.text: We are so lucky in Omaha to have this beautiful, vast parcel of land reserved for family kite-flying, dog play, pick up soccer, flag football and disk games and more. Every June, Bank of the West hosts 40,000 people on the lawn on this park for a Fourth of July concert. In the heart of town, Memorial Park is a favorite destination for thousands of Omaha's every year.

data.title: Beautiful view, fantastic garden.
data.text: Great location for a picnic or just hang around. The garden was simply amazing and was a beauty to walk through.

data.title: Memorial Park
data.text: Enormous park located across the street from University of Nebraska at Omaha.  Great for walking, running, kite-flying, picnics, and frisbee.  Free concerts held here annually on the last Friday in June.  Panoramic views from the war memorial plaques.

data.title: Lovely rose garden
data.text: Nice sculpture in the rose garden, peaceful and tranquil place for a stroll, interesting midcentury walkway overpass above Dodge Street

data.title: ok if you wan to respect people from WW 1,WW 2
data.text: This is a great place take your kids to show them people who have parished in the world wars. The area offers a beautyful garden beind the Memorail. This is a great place to come during Fourth of July because they do have fireworks and bands. There are also bands that perform there around Memeorial day. The green spaces are great for dogs to get exersise, sleading during the winter, and other family activities. The playground for the kids is not all that  great which i hate to say. I mean if you are into honoring the vets who served our country then this is the place for you.

data.title: Beautiful Park
data.text: While driving down Dodge St. this Memorial stuck out. The flag waving in all its beauty & this monument standing behind. A peaceful place to stop & enjoy.

data.title: Concerts
data.text: One of the most beautiful parks in Omaha. Summer concerts(free) and wintertime sled riding are just a couple of thing to enjoy. Free parking.

data.title: Always an icon!
data.text: Have passed the park many times while driving in Dodge St. The monument stands out magnificently on the hill. Beautiful in all seasons. Great attraction for large events. A true icon for the city. The openness makes the city more livable.

data.title: Nice city park- war memorial
data.text:
Nice big city park in the center of town. The war memorial sits right up on top of hill so every time we drive by you can think about it.This park is enjoyed by many, people run or walk here, you will see people out reading a book or having a picnic. Great pace for flag football or Frisbee. Around the fourth of July they have the annual concert and fireworks here. In the winter its the go to sledding hill.
Lots of trees and green space, and some flower gardens.

data.title: Great city park
data.text: This is a great all seasons park. In the winter it is the perfect sledding hill used by many. In the summer it it's home to fireworks and a good concert.

data.title: Lots of room to play :)
data.text: This park is huge!!! It's great if you want to throw down a blanket & read under a tree without people stepping all over you, or just to throw a frisbee!! There is a memorial to the soldiers that served in the wars, and the park is usually used for concerts on the holidays. It's not hard to find, as it sits along Dodge St, one of Omaha's main artery and just across the street from the University of Omaha. This park is also well maintained too.

data.title: GREAT PARK
data.text: We always run through Memorial Park, and it's great for any outdoor activity, whether it be ultimate frisbee, soccer, or anything else you can think of, plus...the concert for the 4th of July is always a blast!

data.title: Memorial Park
data.text: Beautiful park with memorial statue and sometimes events.

data.title: Great views of the city and great memorial to our vets
data.text: My wife and I spent some time wandering around Memorial Park, and we really enjoyed our time there.  The have a very nice Rose Garden just behind the memorial.  This was also rated as one of the best places to go sledding in the U.S., and I can definitely see why!  It's definitely good for someone is looking for something to do for an afternoon.
